summary:
23 year old communication and multimedia design graduate with a minor in creative technologies & entrepreneurship. Now a full time Media & Business master student at the Erasmus University and managerial assistant @ Sana Commerce & Student Assistant @ ErasmusX in Rotterdam, The Netherlands 🇳🇱 

An extroverted protagonist (ENFJ), friendly, outspoken and social, with a passion for leading teams to commonly set goals.

Studied Foreign languages in my Italian high school. Participated in two exchange programs: one at the age of twelve at the Royal Holloway College of London, Egham (🇬🇧); second one at the Foss IB World High School in Tacoma, WA (🇺🇸)

Studied in Groningen, The Netherlands, for my Bachelor in communication & multimedia design with a major in game design & development, and then in Antwerp, Belgium, where I pursued my minor at the Karel De Grote University of Applied Sciences.

school.name: Hanzehogeschool Groningen / Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen

awards.title: Green Ambassador Certificate - Phase 4
awards.description:
The Green Ambassador Program focuses on the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the United Nations. As sustainable ambassadors, students are able to apply the goals in their (future) field and propagate them in the professional field. Some programs are already very far in incorporating the SDGs in their curriculum. They have a complete 'green route' where students work on sustainability projects every year of their studies. Other study programs are still investigating how the SDGs can best be intertwined with the discipline and education.

Phase 4: a Green Ambassador is aware of the world around him, has immersed himself in the theme of sustainability, has conducted his own research and is ready to inspire others and build a sustainable world.

This award was obtained thanks for my efforts in the development of a digital solution that would improve the efficiency of the logistical processes of the Zernike Campus of the city of Groningen while, at the same time, cut down on paper and C02 emissions.

awards.title: #1 Business Expert Award
awards.description: Awarded the first prize for the Project "Echo's Journey" with the team Innoviral, in which my team and I developed a storytelling-driven mobile gaming experience aimed at teaching young kids the dangers of ocean pollution.
awards.issuer: Hanze University of Applied Sciences - Hilco Boerlage

projects.title: CMD2021 4.1 | IWPG Project Innovation Workplace GD/VD/ID (Semester 1)
projects.description:
My team and I are committed to designing a back-end application prototype that will be responsible for the recording, sorting and displacement of cargo meant for a number of different companies within the Zernike Campus Groningen, all in our newly designed Zernike "E-HUB".
The goal for our project is to improve the Eco-friendliness and sustainability of the logistical processes of the Zernike Campus.

projects.title: The Project XL - start up your start up - CTE
projects.description:
In Project XL, all your newly developed knowledge and skills will come together: Project XL is where Creativity and Technology meet in your own startup.

At the end of this course, you will shine with pride, not only because you will have refined your multidisciplinary competences (programming, write a business plan …), but you will also be triggered to start your own company. Anywhere in the world: this course is the perfect introduction to an international career.

projects.title: Project VR (GD) (VIR2)
projects.description: In this project, the students will work in small teams to concept, design and prototype a multifaceted serious game for a various and diverse range of clients. Incorporating elements from VR and AR, together with elements from traditional game design, students will come to understand how new and innovative technologies can be applied to a wide range of educational and persuasive goals.

projects.title: Project EGD (GD) (EGD2)
projects.description: Project aimed at developing a game that makes use of "Emergent" game design in its core.

projects.title: Project Interaction Design [For GD Students]
projects.description: During this project you will create a website with your team. Before you can start this production you will determine the target group and goals of your site. These two elements are up to you, as long as your site is related to the topic "Tiny Houses". The classes of 21st & Theory will require you to deliver several intermediates or Milestones, some individual, others created with your team. Some of these milestones, for example, are: individually conducting interviews with stakeholders and individually creating a responsive lo-fi. Visualizing your concept through a moodboard will be a team efforts and during the production of the site via html&css you can combine your strengths, just make sure everyone has at least one page they have coded. The actual website is not required to be responsive and using a CMS like WordPress or Drupal is against the rules of the game. We encourage you to see the opportunities to add a digital game, or elements of gamification into this site, as long as the entire site reaches the minimum of two times the amount of members, in html-pages.

projects.title: Project Visual Design [For GD Students]
projects.description:
The client is a health/care institution of a city district in a medium-sized city. The organization would like more elderly residents to take part in everyday social life. 

The assignment from the organization is to develop an (analog) game that helps elderly residents to get to know one another better. You are also going to make a video to promote your game, and a flyer with promotional material and personas
